DOC.brief_summary: The investigators are doing this research study to find out how and where dexmedetomidine, a sedative anesthetic, acts in the brain. The investigators will do this by using a machine that records the brains electrical activity, called an electroencephalogram (EEG), and brain imaging scans to look at the brain.
DOC.brief_title: Combined Electroencephalogram, Magnetic Resonance Imaging-Positron Emission Tomography of Dexmedetomidine Induced Sleep
DOC.criteria: American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status I 18 to 35 years of age MRI and/or PET screening criteria not met Abnormal sleep habits/known or suspected sleep disorder(s) Taking medication that alters sleep, cognitive function, or both History of a known neurological or psychiatric problem Younger than 18 or older than 35 years of age
